alert.note: Alert for Cheatham; Davidson; Dickson; Robertson; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 9:28PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Davidson, eastern Dickson, northwestern Williamson, Cheatham and southwestern Robertson Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 927 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ashland City, moving southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Ashland City, Nashville, Madison, Brentwood, Forest Hills, Oak Hill, Coopertown, White Bluff, Belle Meade, Kingston Springs, Pegram, Hermitage, Fairview, Bellevue, Joelton, Pleasant View, Charlotte, Berry Hill and Vanleer. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 180 and 222. Interstate 65 between mile markers 74 and 93. Interstate 24 between mile markers 18 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
